page.title: 15M6 MOTORWAY
page.content: The M6 motorway which passes through the area was opened on 23rd October 1970 by the then Minister of Transport Mr John Peyton. Christiani Shand were the main construction engineers to work on this part of the M6. This section of the motorway is unique in this country in that the two carriage- ways are, in places, up to half a mile apart. The reason for this being the severe winter conditions experienced in this area. In particularly heavy snowfalls it is possible to concen- trate snow clearing activities to one carriageway, using a two-way traffic flow on that carriageway. Tebay West service area supplies the needs of motorists on the north bound carriageway. It was opened in 1972. In 1976 Tebay Mountain Lodge, a Motel, was opened, providing accommodation for up to 70 guests.
